author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Dalit woman from Aavaraikulam in Radhapuram taluk in Tirunelveli district has filed a public interest litigation petition in the Madras High Court Bench here, accusing three caste Hindus of having constructed a 300-metre-long and six-foot-tall wall on a common pathway with the intention of usurping 69 acres of public property and attempting to convert the issue into a caste dispute.

The petitioner, A. Indira (40), accused the three caste Hindus of attempting to create disharmony between caste groups by projecting their construction as a “wall of untouchability”, and sought a direction to the Collector to intervene in the issue. A Division Bench of Justices S. Manikumar and C.T. Selvam on Tuesday directed a government counsel to ascertain the veracity of the petitioner’s claim by next week.
title: PIL petition filed against construction of wall
